page.title: 07A TYPICAL FARM, SHERBORNE
page.content: An average farm in Dorset consists of 340 acres and grows sbout 65 acres of Barley, 25 acres of wheat, 9 acres of Fodder Beat and around 241 acres of grass. The farm has a{dairy herd}of 120cows, of which 27 are in calf and dried off, 60 cows are milked and the remaining 33 are still growing but will soon be put in the dairy herd. This farm has its own{Hereford}bull and when the Dairy Herd start bulling the farmer serves the cows with his own bull.This farm has 65 Herefords, bullocks are kept 11 months before being sold, and the heifers for 8 months. This farm is almost self_sufficient for feed apart from the cows cake, eaten at milking time. All machinery needed for the crops grown is kept on the farm. (continued)
